name: SearchCiTestEvents
description:
Retrieve CI Visibility test events with advanced search capabilities.

Use this tool to obtain CI Visibility test events that match specific search criteria. Ideal for building complex event filtering and searching within Datadog's CI data.

parameters.name: start_time_filter
parameters.description: The minimum time for requested events; can be a date, mathematical expression, or timestamp in milliseconds.

value_schema.description: The minimum time for the requested events; supports date, math, and regular timestamps (in milliseconds).

parameters.name: search_query
parameters.description: The search query using CI Visibility Explorer syntax for filtering test events.

value_schema.description: The search query following the CI Visibility Explorer search syntax.

parameters.name: maximum_event_time
parameters.description: The maximum time for the requested events. Supports date strings, math expressions, or timestamps (in milliseconds).

value_schema.description: The maximum time for the requested events, supports date, math, and regular timestamps (in milliseconds).

parameters.name: time_offset_seconds
parameters.description: The time offset, in seconds, to apply to the query for adjusting the search time range.

value_schema.description: The time offset (in seconds) to apply to the query.

parameters.name: timezone
parameters.description: Specify the timezone as GMT, UTC, a UTC offset (e.g., UTC+1), or a Timezone Database identifier (e.g., America/New_York).

value_schema.description: The timezone can be specified as GMT, UTC, an offset from UTC (like UTC+1), or as a Timezone Database identifier (like America/New_York).

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: Cursor for retrieving the next set of paginated results based on previous queries.

value_schema.description: List following results with a cursor provided in the previous query.

parameters.name: maximum_events_in_response
parameters.description: Specify the maximum number of events to be returned in the response. This limits the size of the result set.

value_schema.description: Maximum number of events in the response.

parameters.name: sort_order
parameters.description: Specify the sorting order for events. Use 'timestamp' for ascending or '-timestamp' for descending order.
